content.text: To establish high standards for teaching practice aligned with the Eduversal Teacher Appraisal System, promote reflective and evidence-based pedagogy through Professional Learning Communities, support continuous professional growth through structured induction and mentoring, integrate STEAM education and 21st-century pedagogies across the curriculum, and ensure all students receive high-quality, culturally responsive instruction that maximizes learning and wellbeing.

items: All Students Can Learn: High expectations for every student, guided by growth mindset principles.
Teaching is Both Art and Science: Balancing evidence-based strategies with creativity and responsiveness.
Learning is Active and Constructive: Emphasizing inquiry, problem-solving, and collaboration.
Relationships Matter: Building positive teacher-student relationships to foster engagement.
Assessment Informs Instruction: Integrating teaching and assessment for continuous improvement.
Continuous Improvement Through Collaboration: Lifelong learning through reflective practice and collaboration.
Culturally Responsive Teaching: Honoring students' identities and experiences in the learning process.

content.text: The Eduversal Teacher Appraisal System is a comprehensive, evidence-based framework designed to elevate teaching quality, foster professional development, and improve student learning outcomes across all Eduversal Partner Schools.

items: Appraisal Cycle and Timeline: Five phases including orientation, data collection, appraisal visit, post-appraisal conferences, and follow-through.
Four Appraisal Domains: Administration (20%), Classroom Observation (60%), Teacher's Work Inspection (20%), and Student Satisfaction Survey.

content.text: A structured process for providing feedback to teachers, including pre-observation conferences, lesson observations, and post-observation conferences.

items: Pre-Observation Conference: Establish shared understanding of lesson context and objectives.
Lesson Observation: Collect evidence on planning, classroom management, instructional process, and assessment.
Post-Observation Conference: Provide evidence-based feedback and set professional growth goals.

content.text: A structured program to support new teachers in their first or second year, ensuring successful integration into the school community.

items: Three-Stage Induction Model: Meeting and preparation, familiarization and welcoming, laying the foundation, and anchoring professional growth.
Mentor-Mentee Partnership: Experienced teachers guide new teachers through regular meetings and lesson observations.

content.text: Teachers are required to thoughtfully plan instruction that maximizes student learning, aligns with curriculum standards, incorporates differentiation, and uses assessment to inform teaching.

items: Diagnostic Assessment: Assess students' prior knowledge before teaching.
Lesson Plan Components: Include learning objectives, success criteria, assessment methods, materials, and lesson sequence.

content.text: PLCs create collaborative teams of teachers working together to improve student learning through inquiry, data analysis, shared practice, and collective problem-solving.

items: PLC Structure: Subject-based, grade-level, vertical, and special focus PLCs.
Meeting Frequency: Typically bi-weekly or monthly, with a focus on student learning.

content.text: Integrate Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics across the curriculum to foster creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, and real-world problem-solving skills.

items: STEAM Implementation Framework: Weekly lessons, after-school programs, and weekend intensive programs.
Teaching STEAM Across the Curriculum: Project-based learning, real-world problem-solving, and inquiry-based learning.

content.text: Integrate technology effectively to enhance teaching and learning, preparing students for a digital world.

items: SAMR Model: Framework for evaluating technology use in lessons.
Digital Learning Strategies: Interactive presentations, formative assessment tools, collaborative tools, and virtual labs.

content.text: Ensure every student has access to high-quality learning experiences through differentiation and inclusion strategies.

items: Universal Design for Learning (UDL): Principles for designing flexible learning experiences.
Differentiation Strategies: Content, process, and product differentiation.

subsections.title: Universal Design for Learning (UDL) in Lesson Planning

content.text: Integrate UDL principles into daily lesson planning to ensure all students can access, engage with, and demonstrate mastery of curriculum content.

items: UDL Lesson Planning Template: Comprehensive guidance for incorporating UDL principles.
Strategies for Mixed-Ability Classrooms: Addressing variability without creating separate lessons.

content.text: Honor students' cultural identities and lived experiences as assets in the learning process.

items: Build Relationships: Learn students' names, show interest in their lives.
Incorporate Diverse Perspectives: Include various cultural viewpoints in the curriculum.

subsections.title: AI and Academic Integrity in Teaching

content.text: Navigate the landscape of artificial intelligence in education responsibly, teaching students to use AI ethically while maintaining academic integrity.

items: Teacher Use of AI: Appropriate uses for lesson planning and resource creation.
Teaching Students About AI: Understanding AI basics, ethical use, and critical evaluation.

subsections.title: Managing Student Behavior and Positive Discipline

content.text: Create safe, respectful, and productive learning environments through proactive behavior management and culturally responsive discipline.

items: Proactive Behavior Management: Establish clear expectations and build positive relationships.
Responding to Misbehavior: Use a graduated approach from non-verbal interventions to logical consequences.

content.text: Recognize that teacher wellbeing directly impacts teaching quality and student outcomes.

items: Workload Management Strategies: Prioritize tasks, batch similar activities, and set boundaries.
Self-Care and Wellbeing: Focus on physical health, mental health, and maintaining joy outside of teaching.

content.text: Maintain evidence of teaching quality standards for accreditation and internal quality assurance.

items: Teacher Appraisal System: Completed observation forms, appraisal reports, and student satisfaction survey results.
Professional Development: Attendance records, PLC meeting notes, and teacher reflection journals.

content.text: Ensure alignment with various educational standards and regulations.

items: CIS Standards: Teaching and assessing for learning, student support systems, staffing and professional development.
WASC Categories: Standards-based student learning in curriculum, instruction, and assessment.
